CSCO.O,UPDATE 1-Cisco buying Israel's Leaba Semiconductor for $320 mln TEL AVIV, March 2 Cisco Systems said on Wednesday it plans to acquire Israel's Leaba Semiconductor, a designer of networking chips, for $320 million in cash plus additional incentives to retain employees. ~BRIEF-Cisco plans to buy Israel's Leaba Semiconductor * Plans to buy Israel's Leaba Semiconductor for $320 million  Further company coverage:    (Reporting by Tova Cohen) ~Commil denied Federal Circuit rehearing in patent loss to Cisco After eight years of litigation, which included a trip to the U.S. Supreme Court, patent licensor Commil USA LLC on Tuesday lost a bid to have a U.S. appeals court reconsider its patent infringement case against network equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc. ~

XOM,UPDATE 3-Exxon Mobil eyes acquisitions, forecasts lowered spending NEW YORK, March 2 Exxon Mobil Corp said on Wednesday it would continue to cut spending as long as crude prices remain low, but the world's largest publicly traded oil company added it may look at potential acquisitions in a bid to offset a dip in production. ~Corporate long bonds, all the rage now NEW YORK, March 2 (IFR) - Long dated bonds are the hottest products in the investment grade corporate bond market right now - a reversal since the start of the year when many nervous investors were balking at anything but short-dated bonds. ~BRIEF-Exxon Mobil production mix will be more oily * Senior vice president says letting natural gas production delcine gradually over 2016-2020 period ~Exxon Mobil sees production up slightly as spending stalls NEW YORK, March 2 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world's largest publicly traded oil company, said on Wednesday its output would rise slowly through 2017 as it continues cutting costs. ~Statoil and ExxonMobil win Irish oil licenses OSLO Oil majors Statoil  and ExxonMobil  have been awarded six options to search for oil and gas offshore Ireland in the country's latest licensing round, Statoil said on Wednesday. ~Statoil and ExxonMobil win Irish oil licenses OSLO, March 2 Oil majors Statoil and ExxonMobil have been awarded six options to search for oil and gas offshore Ireland in the country's latest licensing round, Statoil said on Wednesday. ~
